intro: Dendropanax macrocarpus, commonly known as the large-fruited arrowleaf, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and large, showy fruits. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive waxy surface. The fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it plays a role in seed dispersal by animals.
